results.title: Hearing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Very few people suddenly go deaf, but prolonged exposure to high noise levels can cause serious damage. The film shows how deafness is caused and how objectional noise can be controlled.

results.title: Seeing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Industrial accidents can permanently damage eyesight. The film stresses the necessity of providing protective faceguards and taking precautions at all times.

results.title: Home safe home
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill, Charles Cahill and Associates and Macko Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Shows basic concepts of home safety to elementary students. Major areas covered include: fire, electricity, poisons, slip and falls, cuts and bruises.

results.title: Dermatitis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Dermatitis is a problem in many industries. This film shows how dermatitis is caused and how it can be avoided. Dermatitis in the home is also briefly discussed.

results.title: Why tractors overturn
results.creator_credit: Frank North, A. Frank Bundy, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Wallace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Farming”.
Illustrates how tractor accidents occur and the wisest way of avoiding them. With a demonstration tractor, officers of the National Institute of Agricultural Engineering give instruction on correct tractor usage. Made with co-operation of Massey-Ferguson, Joseph Lucas Ltd.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank North, A. Frank Bundy, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Wallace

results.title: Tractor sense
results.creator_credit: Patrick Pullen, John O'Neill and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Farming”.
Gives examples of three fatal accidents with tractors and explains how they could have been avoided if the tractors had been handled properly.

results.title: Time for thought
results.creator_credit: Patrick Pullen, John O'Neill, Technical and Scientific Films and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer farming”
The film is designed to counteract the high incidence of farm accidents - which commonly occur in connection with tractors. Three accidents to farm workers which were caused by careless use of tractors and other farm equipment are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Pullen, John O’Neill, Technical and Scientific Films and Film Producers Guild

results.title: Means of being rescued
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the importance of storing safety equipment on small craft, of being prepared for an emergency, and the correct distress procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, Patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer. Credits: Producer, Peter Johnson; director, script, Rob McAuley; photographer, Peter Hopwood; editor, Max Lemon; sound, Harry Haws; commentator, Ken Warby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
